Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery panel amphora; exterior, black-figure decoration: to right mane of horse; central female facing right, head and arm only preserved, balancing box on her head; left, head of another female with uncertain object top left. Part of a marriage procession.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 128, pl. XXXIX, no. 355.4)
CVA Boston I / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum, USA Fasc. 14, Museum of Fine Arts, Boston, Fasc. 1 (p.45, pl. 58, no.9)
Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 234, no. 206)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0891)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.5737 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
